nodes.bodyText: We might want to just use a simple JSON column (or a blob)
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,13 @@
+CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS `JSON_SCHEMA_VERSION` (
+  `VERSION_NUM` BIGINT NOT NULL,
+  `SCHEMA_ID` BIGINT NOT NULL,
+  `SEMANTIC_VERSION` VARCHAR(250) CHARACTER SET ascii COLLATE ascii_general_ci DEFAULT NULL,
+  `CREATED_BY` BIGINT NOT NULL,
+  `CREATED_ON` TIMESTAMP(3) NOT NULL,
+  `S3_BUCKET` varchar(100) CHARACTER SET utf8mb4 COLLATE utf8mb4_0900_ai_ci DEFAULT NULL,

@@ -0,0 +1,13 @@
+CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS `JSON_SCHEMA_VERSION` (
+  `VERSION_NUM` BIGINT NOT NULL,

nodes.bodyText: We can simply have two columns that point to the schema_version_id, e.g. source/target
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,8 @@
+CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS `JSON_SCHEMA_DEPENDENCY` (

nodes.bodyText: We might be able to avoid having a nullable id while using the select for update first and still use the insert ignore below with a new id from the id generator.

An organization name must be one or more alphanumeric strings each separated by a dot [ <alpha_num>('.'<alpha_num>)].  An alphanumeric string must start with a letter followed by one or more letters or digits a-z.  The name must be at least 6 characters and no more than 250 characters. Names are case insensitive. Names cannot contain the reserved word 'sagebionetworks'
Might be removed if not used
